attributes.action: Reimburse students caught up in the University strikes
attributes.additional_details: As an example, with lectures costing between £20-£30 an hour, students can lose £500 if 25 lectures are cancelled! And that isn't out of the realm of possibility, with 22 days of strike declared/used in this academic year alone. Even if there were only a thousand students that saw the effects, that's £500,000 lost from the pockets of students. But this is across 74 universities, with over a million students affected. The loss is substantial, but the majority of students don't see any money back.
attributes.background: Thousands of students, across 74 universities, are being caught up in UCU strikes over pensions and pay. Each lecture costs, on average, between £20-£30 an hour. Students are missing essential learning time from a service they're paying for, and it is only fair that they get reimbursed.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  This would be a matter for individual universities.
